page.title: 11RECREATION MORFA BYCHAN
page.content: Every house in Morfa Bychan has a garden.Most are small and open-plan. Lawns,rockeries and mixed plantings of flowers and shrubs are popular. Light sandy soil and salt winds make gardening a challenge.Seaweed compost and farm-yard manure improve the soil structure and increase fertility. Ericas and azaleas grow well in the acid soil.Grey-leaved plants from the Mediterranean thrive in the mild sea-side climate. The gardens are colourful all the year round.Bulbs give a fine display in spring.Annuals flower all summer.Shrubs continue the show into the autumn and winter.
